bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.div1:
UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
No. 6617
NOTICE
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
To the above named Petitioner, JUNICHI YAMAMOTO, and to Frank P. Hellsell, his Attorney:
You and each of you will please take notice that the respondent herein, Luther Weeden, as Commissioner of Im- migration at Seattle, Washington, will present to the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the above entitled court, his motion herein for an order adjudging the bond of the petitioner herein to be forfeited on the 29th day of July, 1922, at the hour of ten o'clock a.m., at the court room of the said district court at Seattle, Washington.
Thos. P. Revelle United States Attorney
Judson F. Faulknor Assistant United States Attorney
Due and timely service of the within notice is hereby acknowledged this 28th day of July, 1922.
Gates and Helsell Attorney for the Petitioner
No. 6617
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
NOTICE
FILED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT Western District of Washington NORTHERN DIVISION
Tx
JUL 29 1922
F.M. Harshberger, Clerk By S.E. Leitch Deputy
